intro: Acronia loreae, commonly known as the Lore's acronia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Acronia loreae thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its botanical significance lies in its unique adaptations to high-altitude conditions and its role in local ecosystems.
